channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CT

item.title: Report X-2024040935
item.description:
Report X-2024040935

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-14
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was found in the unload with the side and bottom of it wet. The box was put in an unlined tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: When the package was opened up it was found that the 1 X 42 oz bottle of Drano had a loose cap and was on its side in the box. This is also an undeclared hazmat because there are no markings on the outside of the box indicating that there is a hazardous material in the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was put in an unlined tote and sent to QA.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was found wet and leaking. Pkg was placed in a lined Hazmat bin along with clay type absorbent material used to clean some of the spilled liquid and taken to the HMPA. DescribePack: Loose caps and failed inner seals allowed liquid to leak wetting and contaminating the contents and carton causing the carton to rip. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed in lined Hazmat bin.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet pkg placed upside down on top of lined Hazmat bin and taken to HMPS. DescribePack: Loose caps allowed liquid to leak wetting, staining and contaminating the contents, packing material and carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed upside down on top of bin.

item.title: Report X-2024040406
item.description:
Report X-2024040406

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-30
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found with the top of it wet and ripped open. The package was put in a lined hazmat tote in the upright position and sent to QA. absorbent material was used to clean up the spill and was put into the hazmat tote also. DescribePack: 1 X 1 Gallon plastic bottle had the top of it dented and had a large 3 inch crack along the seam. The duration of release was about 10 minutes. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The box and bottles were put into a lined hazmat tote. Absorbent material was used to contain and clean up the spill. The material was also placed in the tote.

item.title: Report X-2024040400
item.description:
Report X-2024040400

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet, damaged package was unloaded from trailer and removed from workflow. Package was left on SWAK scale rollers in Unload area for QA member discovery. Package was placed in a plastic tote. DescribePack: One of the four 1-gallon bottles has loose cap, leaked. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic tote to prevent further release or seepage of corrosive liquid.

item.description:
Report X-2024040321

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet pkg placed in unlined plastic bin and taken to the HMPA. DescribePack: Loose cap on 1 x 2.5 gal. plastic jerrican in carton with no Hazmat markings required for regulated hazardous materials and no orientation arrows require for shipments of liquid. Liquid leaked wetting and contaminating the contents and carton causing the tape to fail on the top closures of the carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed in bin.

item.title: Report X-2024040278
item.description:
Report X-2024040278

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet pkg with no Hazmat markings was placed in an unlined unauthorized bin and taken to the HMPA. DescribePack: Inspection of unmarked pkg found 1 x 12 oz. aerosol can with a 1/2" cut on the side near the base of the can which allowed the pressurized contents to escape coating the contents of the four inner pkgs with Ltd Qty diamonds embossed on the packaging. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed in bin.

item.title: Report X-2024040251
item.description:
Report X-2024040251

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet, damaged package was loaded into trailer at 81-CAMD (see SPIDR image), bound for 89-WOOD, where it was again loaded into a trailer bound for 64-SWND. Package was removed from workflow and left on SWAK scale rollers for QA member inspection. Package was retrieved by QA member and placed in a plastic tote. DescribePack: Bottle cap is cracked, permitting leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic tote to prevent further release or seepage of corrosive liquid.
